alert.note: Alert for Polk (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 06 at 1:27AM CST until March 06 at 4:00AM CST by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...QUICK BURST OF HEAVY SNOW FOR EASTERN MINNESOTA AND PORTIONS OF WESTERN WISCONSIN THROUGH 4AM... .A Winter Storm Warning remains in effect through 4 AM from Carver and Wright counties in Minnesota, northeast to Polk county in Wisconsin and Kanabec county in Minnesota. This includes Carver, Hennepin, and Anoka counties in the Twin Cities metro area. A Winter Weather Advisory remains in effect for a row of counties on either side of the warning. Precipitation has transitioned to all snow, with snow expected the rest of the night. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches are expected tonight. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches on top of the glaze of ice received earlier in the night. * WHERE...Wright County. * WHEN...Until 4 AM CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
